clinical_study.brief_title: THIRD NATIONAL REGISTRY OF ACUTE CORONARY SYNDROMES
clinical_study.official_title: THIRD NATIONAL REGISTRY OF ACUTE CORONARY SYNDROMES

lead_sponsor.agency: Third National Registry of Acute Coronary Syndromes

clinical_study.source: Third National Registry of Acute Coronary Syndromes

brief_summary.textblock: The Registry pretends to identify stratification, diagnosis and treatment approaches in patients with Acute Coronary Syndrome (ACS) in community hospitals with tertiary hospitals to optimize resources and identify strategies to improve health care quality through the creation of clinical guidelines that serve for unify management and treatment methods with adherence to international guidelines which include suggestions for treatment and medication.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with complications after presenting ACS
primary_outcome.description: The main objective will be to know the evolution of ACS in third and second level hospitals with a monitoring at a minimum of one year for each patient.

study_pop.textblock: It will include patients older than 18 years with ACS final diagnosis and objective evidence of atherosclerotic coronary disease. Patients will be identified in the emergency department, coronary care units, intensive care units, hospital and hemodynamic laboratories

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
all patients with suspected ACS and will analyze risk factors, chest pain and electrocardiographic characteristics.
Exclusion Criteria:
Patients with secondary ischemia (anaemia, pulmonary thromboembolism, myocarditis) and type II infarction.
